text:
A Fog of Solitude

Raskolnikov sits alone, fog enveloping him.  
His thoughts swirl in confusion.  
Raskolnikov: “What have I done?”  

---

Raskolnikov stares into the distance, lost.  
A sense of dread weighs heavily on him.  
Raskolnikov: “Am I truly alone?”  
Raskolnikov: “Will this ever end?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov argues that his assistance to the dead woman's family is motivated by humanity rather than necessity.
